content.text: The code repository located at /tmp/workdir/baseline_strands_min_20260129/smqttx is currently written in Java 8. Please migrate the entire codebase to Java 17.

reasoningText.text:
I need to migrate a Java project from JDK 8 to JDK 17. Let me start by exploring the repository structure to understand what we're working with.

The steps I'll need to follow:
1. Explore the repository structure
2. Check the current Java version in the pom.xml or build configuration files
3. Update the Java version to 17
4. Run `mvn clean verify` to check if there are any issues
5. Fix any compatibility issues that arise
6. Ensure `mvn clean verify` passes successfully

Let's start by exploring the repository.

                        <artifactId>maven-gpg-plugin</artifactId>
                        <version>1.5</version>
                        <executions>

                                <phase>verify</phase>
                                <goals>
                                    <goal>sign</goal>
                                </goals>
                            </execution>

                    </plugin>
                </plugins>
            </build>
            <distributionManagement>
                <snapshotRepository>
                    <id>ossrh</id>

                </repository>
            </distributionManagement>
        </profile>
    </profiles>
</project>

Text replacement complete and details displayed in console.
File: /tmp/workdir/baseline_strands_min_20260129/smqttx/pom.xml
Replaced 1 occurrence
Old string:         <maven.compiler.source>1.8</maven.compiler.source>
        <maven.compiler.target>1.8</maven.compiler.target>
New string:         <maven.compiler.source>17</maven.compiler.source>
        <maven.compiler.target>17</maven.compiler.target>
Now let's run `mvn clean verify` to see if there are any issues with the Java 17 migration:
